preface.title: About This Guide
preface.para: &suse;® CaaS (Container as a Service) Platform is a &kube;-based container management solution designed to simplify the deployment, management, and scaling of container-based applications and services.

&productname; consists of an integrated software stack on top of &suse; &mos;. &suse; &mos; is a minimalist operating system based on &sle; 12 SP3, dedicated to hosting containers. &suse; &mos; OS inherits the benefits of &sle; in the form of a smaller, simpler, and more robust operating system, optimized for large, clustered deployments. It also features an atomic, transactional update mechanism, making the system more resilient against software-update-related problems.

&suse; &productname; turns four or more dedicated machines into a complete, managed &kube; cluster. Each node can host multiple pods of containers, and the entire system is managed from a web-based dashboard.
For more information, including a list of the various components which make up &productname; please refer to the Release Notes on .
